questions.question: What is runtime polymorphism?
options: Runtime polymorphism is a process in which a call to an overridden method is resolved at runtime rather than at compile-time.
Runtime polymorphism is a process in which a call to an overloaded method is resolved at runtime rather than at compile-time.
